3.18.23  1:19 pm   do you write sheet music on paper or use some digital thing to do it.

     i struggle to pick up a pencil and write my ideas on sheet music, to combat this i write lyrics and chords on a digital notepad, and record melodies and transcribe it later

3.18.23  1:09 pm   Existential crisis of the day:
Are we just a speck of dust in infinite space

     or the sum of how our brains' neurons respond to stimuli

     or the leftovers of primate evolution?

3.16.23  6:25 pm   You say you want your songs to mean both everything and nothing at all,

      however do you yourself have a specific meaning or reason to why you make certain songs?

3.16.23  6:12 pm   Was there a reggae influence on the chorus of "the ground plane"?

     .as I can can hear the syncopated guitar chords and you modulate to the parallel minor and stuff. Also ur rhythmic motif that goes ONE and two AND THREE and four and. (Do yk what im on about here ?) Seems to be most prominent in ur songs released in 2022, now I realise that a lot of them were written at different times throughout the 2010s but it doesn't seem to appear in many other songs from other eras, so was this like a change you made to the song as you were performing it or was it predetermined
3.16.23  5:54 pm   in 2 friends on a beach, how does one guy have all 29 forks but the other can still have one even though it is a 29 pack
3.16.23  5:05 pm   what do you think about new york
3.16.23  2:35 pm   i can't focus on this really really REALLY important thing, how do i concentrate on it?

3.16.23  1:54 pm   i started making music while i was depressed, and the results are music that sounds like you would expect a depressed person to make (depressing), but i never released it. i feel better now, but i'm wondering if i should even bother finishing and releasing, or if i should just focus on making new music?

     finishing the old stuff will get stuff out faster, but working on new stuff will make my body of released work happier, on average (100%). i'm wondering how much that matters, or whether i am overthinking.

     idunno, maybe releasing the older stuff will bring me closure, and someone else catharsis. or maybe it will just make others share in my old uncomfy feelings that i've already worked so hard to shed, and heal from. some people only like music that sounds kinda dark, so releasing it might satisfy my libran desire to please everybody, by offering more variety............. do you have any thoughts/feelings about this? have you ever had a similar dilemma?

3.16.23  11:51 am   I finally wrote a song that I don't think sounds really terrible, but theres a part of my brain that tells me that the chord progression isn't good, the lyrics aren't good, and that i should scrap it all. but i've done so many songs and this is the first one that doesn't sound horrible! what do i do!!!!
3.16.23  11:50 am   what is life?
